---
card: "/images/default.jpg"
tags: [Node]
author: "Milad E. Fahmy"
title: "How to use or execute a package installed using npm"
created: "2021-08-20T13:40:33+02:00"
modified: "2021-08-20T13:40:33+02:00"
---
<div id="___gatsby"><div style="outline:none" tabindex="-1" id="gatsby-focus-wrapper"><div class="layout-container"><main class="grid-container"><article class="article-reader"><h1 class="article-reader__headline">How to use or execute a package installed using npm</h1><div><p>When you install using <code class="language-text">npm</code> a package into your <code class="language-text">node_modules</code> folder, or also globally, how do you use it in your Node.js code?</p><p>Say you install <code class="language-text">lodash</code>, the popular JavaScript utility library, using</p><pre class="prism-code language-bash"><div class="shell-box-top"><span>BASH</span><button type="button">copy</button></div><div class="token-line"><span class="token function">npm</span><span class="token plain"> </span><span class="token function">install</span><span class="token plain"> lodash</span></div><div class="token-line"><span class="token plain">
</span></div></pre><p>This is going to install the package in the local <code class="language-text">node_modules</code> folder.</p><p>To use it in your code, you just need to import it into your program using <code class="language-text">require</code>:</p><pre class="prism-code language-js"><div class="shell-box-top"><span>JS</span><button type="button">copy</button></div><div class="token-line"><span class="token keyword">const</span><span class="token plain"> _ </span><span class="token operator">=</span><span class="token plain"> </span><span class="token function">require</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token string">'lodash'</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span><span class="token plain"></span></div><div class="token-line"><span class="token plain">
</span></div></pre><p>What if your package is an executable?</p><p>In this case, it will put the executable file under the <code class="language-text">node_modules/.bin/</code> folder.</p><p>One easy way to demonstrate this is <a href="https://www.npmjs.com/package/cowsay">cowsay</a>.</p><p>The cowsay package provides a command line program that can be executed to make a cow say something (and other animals as well ðŸ¦Š).</p><p>When you install the package using <code class="language-text">npm install cowsay</code>, it will install itself and a few dependencies in the <code class="language-text">node_modules</code> folder:</p><p><span class="gatsby-resp-image-wrapper" style="position:relative;display:block;margin-left:auto;margin-right:auto;max-width:590px">
<a class="gatsby-resp-image-link" href="/static/b245c50f5080dae16a2525fae0ba2c91/d2c2a/node_modules-content.png" style="display:block" target="_blank" rel="noopener">
<span class="gatsby-resp-image-background-image" style="padding-bottom:58.78378378378378%;position:relative;bottom:0;left:0;background-image:url('data:image/png;base64,');background-size:cover;display:block"></span>
<img class="gatsby-resp-image-image" alt="The node_modules folder content" title="The node_modules folder content" src="/static/b245c50f5080dae16a2525fae0ba2c91/fcda8/node_modules-content.png" srcset="/static/b245c50f5080dae16a2525fae0ba2c91/12f09/node_modules-content.png 148w,/static/b245c50f5080dae16a2525fae0ba2c91/e4a3f/node_modules-content.png 295w,/static/b245c50f5080dae16a2525fae0ba2c91/fcda8/node_modules-content.png 590w,/static/b245c50f5080dae16a2525fae0ba2c91/efc66/node_modules-content.png 885w,/static/b245c50f5080dae16a2525fae0ba2c91/d2c2a/node_modules-content.png 929w" sizes="(max-width: 590px) 100vw, 590px" style="width:100%;height:100%;margin:0;vertical-align:middle;position:absolute;top:0;left:0" loading="lazy" decoding="async">
</a>
</span></p><p>There is a hidden <code class="language-text">.bin</code> folder, which contains symbolic links to the cowsay binaries:</p><p><span class="gatsby-resp-image-wrapper" style="position:relative;display:block;margin-left:auto;margin-right:auto;max-width:590px">
<a class="gatsby-resp-image-link" href="/static/99830aefa055e247397de544ad7b7744/d2c2a/binary-files.png" style="display:block" target="_blank" rel="noopener">
<span class="gatsby-resp-image-background-image" style="padding-bottom:38.513513513513516%;position:relative;bottom:0;left:0;background-image:url('data:image/png;base64,');background-size:cover;display:block"></span>
<img class="gatsby-resp-image-image" alt="The binary files" title="The binary files" src="/static/99830aefa055e247397de544ad7b7744/fcda8/binary-files.png" srcset="/static/99830aefa055e247397de544ad7b7744/12f09/binary-files.png 148w,/static/99830aefa055e247397de544ad7b7744/e4a3f/binary-files.png 295w,/static/99830aefa055e247397de544ad7b7744/fcda8/binary-files.png 590w,/static/99830aefa055e247397de544ad7b7744/efc66/binary-files.png 885w,/static/99830aefa055e247397de544ad7b7744/d2c2a/binary-files.png 929w" sizes="(max-width: 590px) 100vw, 590px" style="width:100%;height:100%;margin:0;vertical-align:middle;position:absolute;top:0;left:0" loading="lazy" decoding="async">
</a>
</span></p><p>How do you execute those?</p><p>You can of course type <code class="language-text">./node_modules/.bin/cowsay</code> to run it, and it works, but <code class="language-text">npx</code>, included in the recent versions of <code class="language-text">npm</code> (since 5.2), is a much better option. You just run:</p><pre class="prism-code language-bash"><div class="shell-box-top"><span>BASH</span><button type="button">copy</button></div><div class="token-line"><span class="token plain">npx cowsay</span></div><div class="token-line"><span class="token plain">
</span></div></pre><p>and <code class="language-text">npx</code> will find the package location.</p><p><span class="gatsby-resp-image-wrapper" style="position:relative;display:block;margin-left:auto;margin-right:auto;max-width:590px">
<a class="gatsby-resp-image-link" href="/static/ad4f3d3a7464bb0f8a2845fe8e6588c2/d2c2a/cow-say.png" style="display:block" target="_blank" rel="noopener">
<span class="gatsby-resp-image-background-image" style="padding-bottom:55.4054054054054%;position:relative;bottom:0;left:0;background-image:url('data:image/png;base64,');background-size:cover;display:block"></span>
<img class="gatsby-resp-image-image" alt="Cow says something" title="Cow says something" src="/static/ad4f3d3a7464bb0f8a2845fe8e6588c2/fcda8/cow-say.png" srcset="/static/ad4f3d3a7464bb0f8a2845fe8e6588c2/12f09/cow-say.png 148w,/static/ad4f3d3a7464bb0f8a2845fe8e6588c2/e4a3f/cow-say.png 295w,/static/ad4f3d3a7464bb0f8a2845fe8e6588c2/fcda8/cow-say.png 590w,/static/ad4f3d3a7464bb0f8a2845fe8e6588c2/efc66/cow-say.png 885w,/static/ad4f3d3a7464bb0f8a2845fe8e6588c2/d2c2a/cow-say.png 929w" sizes="(max-width: 590px) 100vw, 590px" style="width:100%;height:100%;margin:0;vertical-align:middle;position:absolute;top:0;left:0" loading="lazy" decoding="async">
</a>
</span></p></div></article></main></div></div><div id="gatsby-announcer" style="position:absolute;top:0;width:1px;height:1px;padding:0;overflow:hidden;clip:rect(0, 0, 0, 0);white-space:nowrap;border:0" aria-live="assertive" aria-atomic="true"></div></div>
